Figure 1: The Local Plan in relation to other planning documents BACK TO CONTENTS 1.1 A Local Plan is a spatial strategy that sets out a vision and objectives, planning policies, and site allocations that respond to the challenges that local communities are facing and promote sustainable development in the borough. It is a planning policy framework that guides and manages development in the borough over a period of 10-15 years. 1.2 A Local Plan will be prepared by a Local Planning Authority and must be developed in line with planning policy requirements set out by national and regional government as well as in consultation with the local community.
